Reviews.Title: “The only reason to stay here is proximity to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: hepadoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while at a business meeting at the Convention Center next door. The property tries to have a sleek modern look, but the amenities and convenience are anything but. The lobby is narrow and not conducive to meeting colleagues or talking. The room was small and poorly equipped - virtually no outlets were available, wireless internet service was extremely weak and frustrating to access. The bathroom amenities and towels were on a cart below the sink, hard to find and inconvenient. The view of the sea would have been nice were it not for the industrial buildings just in front. The room cleaning service knocked on our door at 8 AM and instructed me to leave the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door if I didn't want to be interrupted at that hour. The location is remote, and requires a 20 minute subway to the center of town. Breakfast was adequate but hardly appealing. Service was pleasant but not overly accommodating, and the hotel did not provide on a critical wake-up call I requested the evening before from my room, but fortunately I used my phone as a back-up. Were this not the official meeting hotel adjacent to the convention center there would be no redeeming features, and next time I would rather stay in a comfortable, well-located hotel and take the subway to the meeting. Marriott should reconsider owning and supervising this property, or make it more pleasant for guests. A disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: The hotel services are very good. Free wifi at the lobby. Nice mall across the street. Close to a metro station but far from the city center. Better for business travelers than for tourists

Reviews.Title: “big hotel; may be good for business/conference - but far away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: MUUAustria
Reviews.Content: the AC hotel is a big, sterile modern hotel with the usual ameinites. however, the WIFI did not work in my room (and it was quite expensive, too! they refunded the cost after i complained, though. nevertheless, it is really annoying if you need a connection for work and cannot have it in your own room. that simply should not happen in a hotel of this class). the surroundings are boring and it is quite a way from there to downtown. the beaches are close, though, there is a huge shopping complex close by. i would defefinetely never recommend the hotel for anything but a business meeting. for tourism, barcelona has better options.

Reviews.Title: “New, spotless hotel away from downtown, poor WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Jmacq92
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this hotel during a seminar. It is quite new, I’d say 4-5 years. As a result furniture, room and bathroom are modern and very clean. Flat screen TV includes international channels (BBC, CNN, Russian, etc…). The front desk is well staffed and service is good. The metro (station across the street) can take you downtown in only 15 minutes, but the hotel surroundings are unappealing, although safe: a couple of hotels are located across the street, as well as a large shopping mall. The unattractive beach is very difficult to access, due to railways and highways. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are quiet, although not as quiet as one could expect for a hotel that recent. A small pool shares the 13th floor with a large gym. Meeting rooms are large and with a lot of sunlight. WiFi connection is terrible (hence the mediocre rating). I didn’t try the in-room WiFi, as the hotel charges a stupendous 12 euros a day for it. But it took me several attempts to connect to the free WiFi in the lobby, only to be kicked out after 20 minutes. Only very late at night was I able to connect to the lobby WiFi at acceptable speeds. Four computers and a printer are available in the lobby but, surprise: you have to buy a card to use them!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Omar d
Reviews.Content: Its a little bit far from the center of town, buts its very comfy and next to a huge shopping mall. They belong to Marriott so you know the standards are good. Breakfast is excellent and the room was well priced. Totally recomend this hotel also its very close to the beach and the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at quite safe area”
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman4
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at this hotel for the Mobile World Congress . the rooms are spacious , clean and well maintained . Diagonal Mar, a large commercial center is across the street where you can find anything you want especially nice food at restaurant on the roof . the are is quite and safe and it is 5 minute to the metro where you need 1 change to reach Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring....”
Reviews.Author: lianne_marshall
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AC in Barcelona in January this year. AC are new to the Marriott chain and i was eager to use my Marriott discount to try them out and report back to my colleagues!! I chose this hotel as i was initially intrigued by the rooftop swimming pool (not that i would have considered using this in January but loved the idea of it being there!) but upon looking through the photos the rooms sold themselves to me! A taxi from the airport was around 25 euros and didn't take long at all - our taxi driver was really friendly and pointed out loads of sights along the way - he earned his tip!! The hotel is in the business district but don't let it put you off! During the summer the open top bus (green route) runs along this way so you can connect with the more touristy routes from here! The room was AMAZING thank you so much for the upgrade! The room had a free mini bar which was filled daily with more than enough for 2 people to have as a lovely perk! There was a sitting area and a lovely large bedroom. The bathroom had a very large bath and a double shower which was massive! The amenities provided meant that i didn't really need to bother taking any toiletries which was a really good help, also they provided robes which were lovely for relaxing around the room - all in all the room as that nice it almost meant i didn't want to go and explore the city!!! The location of the hotel may put leisure travellers off but i must say that the location worked really well for us. We were on a 3 day break and found enough time to fit the essentials in. The hotel is located right near a bus, tram and tube stop which meant that we had a million options for travel. We took a tram to the nearest 'open top bus tour' stop which didn't take long at all and only cost a couple of euros. This allowed us to see all of the sights in a day - we got off at Parc Guell which took around 2 hours to complete with enough time to see everything! We found that after the open top tour we were ready to head back to the hotel to get changed before eating out. We got the tube back to the hotel and had a quick change and headed to the Diagonal Mar which was a large shopping centre directly opposite the Hotel which had a massive range of shops and eating establishments to choose from. Having this opposite us meant that we could pop back, get changed and then have a range of places to eat from with our having to worry about how to get back to the Hotel without the need for taxis etc. As a complete bonus, Cirque Du Soleil were set up literally minutes away from the hotel which provided us with a nights entertainment which we were nit expecting - the show was fab and was worth the money paid. This hotel is not a city centre hotel but had the advantage of being well placed with transport links and also having the Diagonal Mar right opposite meant you could safely walk to and from dinner without having the worry of being in the City Centre and having to navigate back to the hotel. Breakfast in the hotel was well worth getting up early for and set you up for the rest of the day. All in all, i have definitely recommended this Hotel to my colleagues and friends..........and i hope to go back in better weather when i can use the rooftop swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business”
Reviews.Author: Payka
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for business and for longer breaks. Great panorama over the city from the roof. Nice swimming pool. Typical AC hotel. 7 minutes drive b ytaxi from the city center.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Rafalek333_11
Reviews.Content: far away from city center, this hotel is ideal for company convention but not for touristic stay specially for familles with kidds. I have room on 20th flor with panoramic view on city, breakfast without tomatoes ( for me it was a drama) . Oposite the street is large shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving...”
Reviews.Author: MichelDupuis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AC Hotel in Barcelona late January 2012 and I was looking forward to my stay. I know and trust the brand Marriott for many years and have a good idea of what to expect. I was very surprised with my experience at AC hotel Barcelona and I'm now very confused with this brand of Marriott. Not sure if they are trying to imitate W from Starwood or what but their offer is far from being clear. In a nutshell, here are some observations on my stay: 1.The hotel is very far from the center... so think about many taxis rides during your stay. 2. If you stay during winter months, expect to stay in a sauna. The temperature in my room was 26C and when I tried to used the air conditioning, it was heat coming out instead. I asked the front desk if maintenance could check what is wrong and I've been told that the hotel shuts down the AC for the winter months so there is no way to have cool air in the room. I found this very cheap and not in line with Marriott's standards - Bad Surprise#1. 3. The room rates are attractive but then you get stucked in paying a lot for any basic service in the hotel (wifi at 12 Euros per day, minimal and below par breakfast at 23 Euros and parking at 24 Euros each per day). Very surprised to see wifi at 12 euros per day when the trend in most hotels is to have it included - Bad Surprise #2. 4. I was looking to have a coffee in the morning but the hotel bar on the 1st floor was closed and the main restaurant refused to sell me coffees and told me that my only option was to get it from room service at almost 10 Euros with the 4 euros delivery charge - Bad Surprise # 3. 4. Finally, in my room, there was only 1 electrical outlet and non available at the desk. On top of it, the only outlet is linked to the main lighting switch in the room and it dies as soon as you shut the lights at night. So if you have your phone charging to make sure it will be full the next morning (of to use it as alarm clock), you'll be in for another surprise when you'll find it dead empty the next morning - Bad Surprise #4 All in all, I think Marriott brand managers have some serious work to do with this brand. I think having Marriott associated to the chain in this case is not helping the overall brand and will now discourage me from using any of the chain's hotels as I'm afraid I won't know what to expect anymore. SPG has their standards more buttoned down. On the positive side, the minibar is complemetary and the staff if ok. Would I go back or use AC brand again? No. What about any other Marriott brands? Most likely not.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but far from the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: elenkahu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for business and just for one night. The hotel is good and modern: rooms are good size and clean, but I believe that something is wrong with air conditioning system. My room was extremely cold and i could not make it warm so ended up falling asleep in a bath robe. Minibar is included in your room rate so enjoy it. Breakfast is sufficient but not as diverse as in the rest of the Marriott hotels. If breakfast is not included in your rate, do not bother paying premium for it and just go to the shopping center nearby to get some food. Staff was helpful but it does take a while to check in and check out for some reason. All in all the stay in the hotel was good, but I think this hotel is more for business people than tourists. If you want to stay closer to main tourist attractions, do stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall, unfortunately THE staff is kind of rude not helpful”
Reviews.Author: spemil
Reviews.Content: Stayer in the hotel for 4 nights. First of all, even if we had a reservation it took us almost one hour to check in. Second, even if when I made the reservation I explicitly asked for a roo with sea view ( and I received a mail back stating that they would have take care of my request) we ended up staying in a room on low floor overlooking a street. Third of all, one evening my key to the room was not working and I had to go up to the concierge and back to my room floor 4 times before the problem was solved and I didn't even received a "we are sorry for the inconvenience " . So I would say that, notwithstanding the hotel is modern and nice overall, the service is really below average, making the staying in this hotel an ok experience and nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot Rewards is awful but staff at AC Forum is friendly.”
Reviews.Author: khorkina3
Reviews.Content: I paid my reservations through Easyjet and paid same if not more than through Marriott. And yet Marriott refuses to give me points for my stay. I will definitely not stay at another Marriott again until this is rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: dt95
Reviews.Content: This is a big impersonal convention hotel. Stayed in a junior suite - room was nice - small desk otherwise was fine. Breakfast buffet was fine although there was - NO SERVICE - absolutely none - in 20 minutes no one came to my table - no one offered anything! Excercise facilities were good. This hotel was close to my office, but not too much else.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alessandr078
Reviews.Content: Great room, beautiful view, few minutes from the beach, nice food, just outside the congress center.

Reviews.Title: “holliday”
Reviews.Author: Montpellier_034
Reviews.Content: Hotel agreable, tres bon accueil, situation ideale face a la mer, transport facile metro ou tramway. Chambres agreables + salle de sport et piscine.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee maker, no room safe, no room clock.”
Reviews.Author: MarJan6861
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here while my wife was attending a conference. We were very surprised that this business hotel’s rooms did not have a coffee maker, or a room safe, and not even a clock. I called the desk about the clock and was told that they have none. The room was often too warm for our tastes. Even though we had the room temp set as cold as the a/c would get, it never really cooled off enough. We had the maintenance staff look at it and that helped, but only a little. Some good things about this hotel include very attentive housekeeping staff. The front desk staff were helpful and informative. But if you want to mail a postcard back home, the hotel has no stamps. We purchased stamps at a post office located on the lower level of shopping mall across from the hotel. Also, the metro is just a short walk away. But, you cannot see the metro entrance from the hotel as it is behind a high rise apartment building. We felt very comfortable riding the metro. Make sure that you purchased the “T-10” ticket for 8.25 euros. It is good for 10 rides and we shared it with one another. The metro ticket machine has an English option. We liked that our hotel room had wood floors. Our room had a balcony overlooking the Mediterranean Sea which was great for sunsets. As has been previously mentioned, the free mini bar refrigerator is stocked daily and it has sufficient space for your own beverages. We frequently used evening room service. That service was quick and the meals were good. If you attending a conference, then this hotel is an ideal location. But to explore the old city center of Barcelona you will need to use the metro and it is about 8 stops to the Gothic quarter. To calculate how long it will take on the metro, use about 2 minutes per stop but not including transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AC Forum beginning of November for a conference. Ther hotel was very convenient because it was just around the corner to the convention center. Other than that I was disappointed. There is no W-LAN in the rooms. There should have been one in the lobby, but if you could connect, it was so sloooow. Breakfast was not included in the room. I tried it one time and it was not worth the money, like what you would expect in a cheap 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to RR station...but not really”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: The hotel stated it was close to the RR station 650 ft., which it is, but you cannot exit the RR station building near the hotel. So you have to exit one place and walk a few blocks down the street to the hotel. The lobby was nice and the attendants at the front desk were very helpful. The shower was Wonderful! The room was fairly large according to European standards. The tv did not have one English speaking channel, a disappointment from a Marriott property. Wired Internet in the room costs 20 euro for 24 hrs but worked great. I had dinner one night in the hotel and it was ok. I thought the area the hotel was in wa a bit dicey but a coworker/friend that lives in Madrid told me it was fine as long as I was not walking in the area very late at night. My two main things to see while in Madrid were the le Hermitage exhibit at the Prado museum and the Botanical Gardens, both of which were in easy walking distance of the hotel. I also did the hop on and hop off bus tour thru the historic district, it was very goid except we had to take an alternate route for part of it due to protests going on that day. The hotel was on a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IainBrighton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine based on location to the conference centre but not a great place to stay if you are planning to visit Barcelona as a tourist. Hotel was not cheap at €200 per night and to be honest, the hotel is best described as a functional hotel catering for conference visitors. The hotel has no real soul and our party met in the Hilton Bar every night as there was a much better buzz there. Room was clean and whilst a number of colleagues complained about the hard beds, i have to be honest and say I did not have any particular concerns. The reception staff were always polite and friendly. Overall, stay there for the conference centre but not as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to be”
Reviews.Author: kmeuleman
Reviews.Content: Had to be in the conference centre for a couple of days. Usually I take the Hilton overthere but is was full. The room was slightly smaller than the (upgraded) one in the Hilton I usually have. However, the swimming pool was still open. The water (at 15°C) was just what you need after using one of the two sauna or one of both steam rooms. After a short swim, you can relax in one of three jacusis. Massages are available in a treatment room, unfortunately I did not have the time to take one. Only drawback, I had to ask for an internet access card at the reception to get internet access. They could have offered one at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for conferences, but could do better for business people”
Reviews.Author: andymwood
Reviews.Content: If you're at the Forum building for a conference - this hotel has a great location. That said, If you're wanting to use this as a base to visit Barcelona - be prepared for @20 min ride on the metro/tram or a taxi ride - you are a way out of town. Still, its only about 5 mins walk from the nearest tram stop and metros - so pretty easy to get about (invest in a multi-journey ticket). Not too expensive (@30-40 euros in Oct 2011) if you wanted to get there straight from the airport by taxi. Its a pity Barcelona doesn't make the bicycles easier to hire for tourists. Of course, as anywhere in Barcelona, be wary with your valuables. Rooms are comfortable. Mine was on the small side, although a good sized desk and TV. (Music centre, no dvd player). I'd agree with a previous comment - quite dark décor throughout - especially if you're in one of the rooms (like I was) with only a single window: maybe that works better in the summer because in the winter, it can be gloomy. When I arrived only wi-fi is available - and at a cost of @12e / day. Personally I think this service should be free in hotels: especially a conference venue as you're likely to be there on business. I found the staff excellent - friendly, efficient and accommodating. No coffee/tea in the rooms, although we did have a free mini-bar, restocked daily with a beer and a selection of soft drinks. Hotel bar is pleasant enough, and not badly priced in comparison to other hotels - and there are a few around to choose from. Food is excellent, breakfast well worth the investment. We didn't eat there for other meals - if the conference isn't providing food the shopping centre across the road has a wide selection of excellent bars and restaurants for all budgets/tastes to meet up and network/eat cheaper. I didn't use the gym/pool as I was nursing injury. Pity - they look very good. If you're a runner/jogger there are some splendid looking runs outside - either along the coast or up the Diagonal. So - good for a business person, would be ok for solo, couples and friends but I can't see it being a good venue for families. If you're coming to a conference/business nearby - splendid. If you wanted to see Barcelona.. something more central could be better but you may get a good deal (if there are no conferences on) which would make up for the travel - especially booking in advance like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel and Close to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: LABillie
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it has very easy a access to the primary train station in Barcelona, which was convenient because I had business the next days outside the city. The hotel is very new with plenty of the ammenties that I'm accustomed to finding in American hotels (tub/shower, shampoo, toiletries) and a softer, more comfortable bed than I find in most European hotels. Upon arrival, I was delighted that they let us check in during the morning, because we were very tired after our international flight from Toronto. The location is not especially proximate to the main tourist attractions in Barcelona. However, the efficient subway system helped to offset this downside.

Reviews.Title: “Not my type of hotel. But good service indeed.”
Reviews.Author: Hedin
Reviews.Content: I blame the architect's selection of dark, serious colours for a hotel that is just facing the sea. I blame the fact that windows were quite short, limiting the view enjoyment. THe hotel staff was very helpful, also for room service. I had particular needs and in all cases I was fully satisfied. The room dining proved positive as well. Didn't see the spa area, unfortunately. For sure my first choice, should I go back to the CCIB center -just attached.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kambiz M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in September 2011. Nice and clean hotel, ocean view rooms. staff are very friendly, pool & spa is fantastic. Close to Beach & Metro. We will stay there in our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed but not quit there”
Reviews.Author: sparky_112358
Reviews.Content: With a bit of work this hotel could break free from its bonds and be truly great, stay here for the comfortable rooms and enjoy the restaurant. The location eas good with tram, metro and bus links to the city and only €15 by taxi to thr Francesc Marie. The check in could have been smoother and large quesue's at checkout prevented another star. Generally the staff were very good and the rooms comfortable and clean

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Conference”
Reviews.Author: Venusian2000
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel, because it is right next to the Barcelona International Convention Center, where I had to attend the conference. It is also across the big shopping center, Diagonal Mar, and it is very conveniently located. It is also close to water, and it takes about 10-15 minutes by car to go to downtown from the hotel. I like the modern decor throughout the hotel and beautiful interior design. The room is large enough and comfortable, and mini bar is free of charge. Hotel staff are polite, speak good English, and helpful. One of the male staff was so very helpful to pick a few restaurants out of my list that I had prepared. Overall, it is a very nice hotel, especially for conference attendees. The breakfast is too pricy for what they offer. The internet wifi is free in the lobby, but the connection for the guest room has to be purchased. The inconvenience is that the purchase only lasts 24 hours, and you have to go to the lobby and purchase a new ticket. I don't know if it is eco-issues or paper products issues in Barcelona, but there is no facial tissue paper in the guest room except a tiny packet of maybe 6-7 pieces of tissue paper.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel, but no safe in room”
Reviews.Author: Elsa12345
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 20/25 minutes taxi ride from the Airport. The reception staff are welcoming and friendly, and have a good comand of English.The bedrooms are clean and well apointed although small. I was unable to find a safe in the room, which is bizare for a business hotel, so was unable to lock up my laptop and passport. If you like a comfortable feather pillow - take your own the hard foam pillows are shocking. The breakfast is the ususal hotel fare, but fresh and nicely displayed although it was a challenge to get cold milk for tea. The dinner menu is dull and uninteresting , and clearly most people eat out for that reason, the restaurant only had two elderly diners. Generally a good hotel with a small but nice pool on 13th floor.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: molly6400
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in August for a short break away. Hotel is excellent, breakfast is very good and staff helpfull. Rooms are sleek and modern but a bit on the small side and we were given a room with bad view and smell of smoke but in fairness we were given a better room the next day. As previous reviewers said ask for sea view on a high floor. Pool is small but lovely and great hot tubs, not at all suitable for children. Beach is a short walk and great shopping centre across the road with lots of places to eat. As another reviewer said take the tourist bus at the front door, it's a great way to get to see everything. Taxis are also available all day and night at the front door. Free mini bar is nice touch. Great for couple on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rob_tino
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 straight nights at this hotel. Only one computer out of four was available for internet, and free wireless internet in the public areas never worked during my stay. They advertise free mini-bar, but there is very little in the mini-bar... 1 beer, 1 coke, etc and 2 small bottles of water. Cleaning was OK... but I always found someon's hair in my bathtub... I'm bald! When I arrived I said I need another bed when my daughter arrived, but I had to get another room instead. They said they couldn't accomodate. Very slow service for a 4-star hotel, but relatively friendly staff. Morning buffet breakfast is good... but 20 euros additional cost. Close to beaches... but not worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at this hotel again!!”
Reviews.Author: 75Frances
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was by default as we thought we had booked into AC Diplomatic and didn't realise we were booked in to AC Barcelona until we arrived at Diplomatic. Despite checking for accommodation in AC Diplomatic at some point the website seemed to default us to AC Barcelona (URL on my email confirmation was for AC Diplomatic). Anyhow check in proces at AC Barcelona extremely slow and despite their claim check in is from 12:00 this only means that you can complete the check in process from then but your room will not be ready until 3.00 pm!! Our room was booked for 3 people and despite reiterating this at check in when we got to room no 3rd bed had been added for our daughter. We stayed at this hotel at beginning and end of a cruise and this happened on both occasions!!.The hotel lacked atmosphere and the small roof pool with its waist high perspext surround certainly isn't child friendly. Good shopping centre opposite hotel which is definitely needed as centre of Barcelona, Las Ramblas etc is a good taxi ride away!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matka-arvostelut
Reviews.Content: AC Barcelona is a very nice hotel for business purposes. Everything is dealt with a professional touch. I recommend AC warmly! There are diverse meeting and conference rooms to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings - If at all possible stay at the Barcelona Princess!”
Reviews.Author: aash23
Reviews.Content: Having visited Barcelona a couple of years ago, staying at the Barcelona Princess just across the road, we decided to try something different. The hotel is nice and modern however there are a number of shortfalls. The staff are incredibly miserable, Eva who checked us in was very miserable and depressing - never once smiled. Breakfast was included in our room rate - I found out this normally cost 20 Eur. If I had paid 20 Eur I would be seriously upset! Poor coffee & very poor hot selection. The rooms were acceptable - rooms at Barcelona Princess were exceptional. We had a room on the 22nd floor which did have a great view! All in all, a perfectly acceptable hotel but it does fall short in many many ways. The free business centre was a nice and welcomed addition which provided free internet (Ask for a pass at Reception).

Reviews.Title: “Wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: Ofir_yo7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just Wow. I was thinking about how to describe it, but came up with only one: wow... I'm traveling a lot on bussiness, but never saw this attention to details from any hotel. The spenish design is seen in every detail. The mini bar that is free, added value to the hotel. Did not had the chance to try the pool, however, got to see that, and it is amazing, on floor 13, overlooking the city and beach. Rooms are just fantastic, big and clean. Had a great stay. Recommend for both leisure and bussiness.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, but we won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: CharOdd
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our holiday in Barcelona, where we stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. As other people have pointed out in their reviews, the hotel has both good and bad points. We were very happy with the room in itself; the size was fine and the view was nice. The air conditioning and bathroom were satisfactory. The free minibar was a nice detail, as well as the free bathroom supplies. Generally, the staff was nice and proficient in English, although there were a few people who were less service minded and even rude. There was a lot of noise from the corridor outside the room, as well as the rooms around us. When someone in the next room was speaking, it literally sounded like they were sitting inside our room. We could also hear music from the area around the hotel very well, even though we stayed in the top floor. We were happy with the location of the hotel, as it is close to the beach, a shopping mall, and both tram and metro stations. There is also a tourist bus stop right outside the hotel, which will take you to all the main attractions of the city. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant once, and it was average, but not worth its price. Thee pool area is very nice, although it is quite small. We weren't completely happy with the cleaning staff, as we could hear them very well from our room. One of the last days we were there, we were disturbed at about 10 am by a cleaning lady who opened our door on two occasions and shouted something in Spanish, apparently eager for us to get out of the room so that she could clean it. When you're on holiday, you should be allowed to get up at your own pace without being disturbed. All in all, we had a pleasant experience, but I am not sure if we would choose this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Super functional... not centrally located though. No wireless in rooms”
Reviews.Author: LambkinBern
Reviews.Content: This hotel is attached to the CCIB Conference Centre in Barcelona, so if you're in town for a conference this is the easiest and best place to stay. However, if you're in for sightseeing there are probably better located hotels. In all, the hotel ticked all the right boxes, apart from one major failing - wireless - or the lack of it in rooms, which is unforgivable for a business hotel. Rooms were clean, relatively small, and basic. Bathroom sufficed. As mentioned, no in-room internet is shocking. There was basic TV entertainment. Breakfast served on the 4th floor was excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “This was my 6th time in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyu2s
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the AC Barcelona many times. The employees are always so friendly and very helpful. We had an incident with a taxi driver who was trying to cheat us on the fare and the people at the desk helped us out. They talked to him and also wrote a report to the taxi company. We are from the US and do not speak Spanish. There help was so appreciated. The rooms are so nice too. The best view of the city or ocean. Very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business trip but overbooked from AC Diploma!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clelia_SC
Reviews.Content: A bit disapointed as we originally book the AC diploma and been told last minute that they overbooked it and we landed there. Then the service was good and hotel is a very nice modern hotel, all you need in the bathroom (slippers, robe...) But location is not great, nothing to do in the area for a bit of tourism outside of meetings. Then would have prefer the sea view of course especially after the disapointment to not be in the rigth hotel. And breakfast 21,60€, really?? Then free internet is in the lobby only. Even on business I don't want to make my company pay this kind of amount!! Overall, great for a night but not really more.

Reviews.Title: “Disrespectful, noisy and not all that”
Reviews.Author: sammidford
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are OK, pokey, nothing special and a bit grubby.... all of which you can live with. However the cleaning staff are disrespectful and noisy, shouting at one another down the corridor. I was even rung up by the cleaning staff at 1pm to ask if I wanted my room cleaning, but had a do not disturb sign on the door. I had stayed at the AC because of a music festival that finished at 5am at the forum which is next door, so had wanted to sleep until late, which is understandable. About 40% of the guests were there for the same reason. I'm sure this hotel is OK for someone getting up before the noisy and disrespectful cleaning staff start, but I would stay at the Zero across the road it is a far superior hotel (which was full, unfortunately). The only good thing about this hotel is that spa, but the complimentary towels vanished on the day the festival started. Maybe this hotel doesn't trust it's guests?

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: RedSamRackham
Reviews.Content: Had my backpack loaded with valuables stolen from right at my feet in the hotel's business center with security cameras and a security guard standing in the lobby. They offered no assistance in dealing with the Spanish police or with the US consulate; not even a ride to the police stations. They offered no compensation and in fact told us that if we wanted to call the police, they would charge it to our room.They just held out until they knew we would leave Spain. For a "high class" hotel, the rooms were mediocre and the service was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ToxicAlien
Reviews.Content: Lived there for 8 nights.The hotel had a boring location even though it's close to the beach.There's a shopping center just across the road callad Diagonal mar which was ok...but personal I'm not a fan of big shopping centers. I dont remember what floor our room was on ,but it was pretty high up with awonderfull seaweiw.but really noisy in the night time from some arrangements further down and other beach parties. The rom was very nice and clean,but 2 of the days we had to point out to the staff that our room had not been cleaned,even though it was way out on the afternoon. The pool area is small an overcrowded,and the breakfast was the poorest hotel breakfast I've ever had. The lobby had free wifi but was also overcrowded from time to another It's a new,modern and clean hotel,but way to expensive compared to what you get..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlBiz49
Reviews.Content: 2 days business plus 2 days add-on holiday. Location initially seemed a problem (it's quite a long way from the city centre) but there is a metro stop 100 m from the hotel, and a taxi rank right in front of the hotel. There's a huge shopping m,all with hypermarket right in front of the hotel, and a restaurant/bar complex very close with a number of the chain Spanish food outlets - one or two of which surprised us by their excellence. It's almost on the beach, it has a great pool (could use heating!) and fitness centre. The rooms are beautiful, modern practical, and there's a free (limited) mini-bar, satellite TV and great views. The beds are about as comfortable as I have found anywhere in the world. Staff are friendly and multi-lingual, they gave us an upgrade on arrival as we were staying longer than average, and also a free late check-out. Negatives: Wifi is via a daily-purchase card, which for a business/conference hotel is not great, and the lighting system is bizarre. Breakfast is seriously overpriced and you don't have the option of just getting a coffee and a juice in the bar before 11.00 am, but there are several typical Spanish bars just 5 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for almost a week while working in barcelona. the hotel is a bit far away from the city - 40 minute walk to rambla or 10 minute and 10 euro in taxi. but as we often drove out of the city for locations it was ok not to deal with the barcelona traffic and it was very quiet at night. it has a small gym with rather outdated work out machines, but everythign is very clean. there is sauna, jacuzzi and steam baths, which i liked and a roof top pool and terrace which also was cool. the minus was that it was impossible to order coffee or food at the pool area- as the pool bar was not open.... the minibar is free (soft drinks and beer) and the gym /pool area also provides free water (nice). the breakfast is very good with a big selection and fresh good foods. BUT whenever we ordered anything else from the hotel kitchen (room service or at the restaurant) it was really bad! we tried to eat in the city but because we had to have meetings in the hotel (we were a larger group) we often ate there in the late evenings and it was really not satisfying! staff: some were really nice and some were less nice. no one was rude to me, and i experienced them beeing mostly very frindly/ helpful. room: i had room 1506 (changed from room 10th floor as my room smelled of sewer there) and i had a nice view over barcelona and the room was well equipped and clean. rooms have mini stereos so i regretted that i had forgotten my mini jack stick to my iphone. wifi: WAY TOO EXPENSIVE! in the lobby it is free. but in the rooms they charge 12 euro per day and it is soooooooooooooo slow and bad! some days just opening FB or mail could take forever. forget internet banking or youtube! next time i would stay elsewhere- with more stylish and luxurious feel, better food and closer to the city centre. it is not a cheap hotel and i am glad i didnt have to pay 200 euro plus per night as i only think it was maybe 100 euro worth.

Reviews.Title: “Booking confirmed by hotel & upon arrival they were full!”
Reviews.Author: davisonjames_KL
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally disappointed by the booking direct to the hotel, along with a follow up email direct to the hotel reservation desk to confirm, to arrive at the hotel and go through the full check in process (copy of passport & credit card taken) to then be told the hotel is full and i had to move to their sister hotel! I asked what the cost difference was as paying 170 euro is a lot for a hotel of this quality (in comparison to the superior hilton next door). Appalling service by the staff on reception along with a front desk manager who never once apologised and stated it was a "system problem". Never stay at this hotel or chain again. Five days later I stayed at the hilton (next door) and the quality of the service, staff, food, room, etc was FAR superior to the AC Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern and comfortable hotel in a great location - We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sush8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AC for 4 days and loved almost everything about it!! It's very close to being five star standard. Beautiful and very comfortable 22-storey hotel, with breathtaking views from the rooms. Very modern, stylish and airy. Away from the centre, so not a noisy area at all. La Rambla is a taxi ride away (around €12) - not too bad we thought. c.€23 from the airport. c.€26 to Nou Camp - which is quite a bit for one way but worth the experience we had. Check in advance if there are any concerts/matches happening at Nou Camp because there are no stadium tours on these days. Everything you need is near the hotel inc. tour bus stop (c.€23 per person) and taxi stand right outside, bus and train. There's a shopping mall across the street. The beach is only a 5 minute walk behind the hotel. Perfect location for a family. [The kids attractions at Mount Tibidabo were closed on the day we went so the kids missed that. Maybe check at the hotel if they can check this for you in advance]. Breakfast was expensive (c.€22), but we think it was worth the money for a good buffet breakfast. Kids eat with free with a paying adult. Really clean rooms, cleaned everyday. Free mini bar that is restocked everyday. Interconnecting Junior suite was great, TV for mum and dad's room and TV for kids' room. Perfect. Did I mention the views, stunning!!! Free internet in the lobby. Downside was the AC did not work. The room was very hot some nights. Maybe check with them before you book - I can imagine how hot it could get in the summer. The restaraunt was expensive and doesn't really cater for vegetarians, but there are plenty of restaraunts in the mall across the street and on La Rambla. Some staff are not very friendly, but friendly enough to help when approached. When we checked in at the hotel, we were asked to pay a refundable deposit of €50 per night. This was a bit of a shock because we were not expecting to have to pay extra and it had to come out of our spending money. Upon refunding the money back onto our card, we were told it would take 7-10 days to credit back into our account. After making a fuss at checkout, the manager arranged a quick transfer back which should take 48 hrs to credit. It hasn't been 48hrs yet, so fingers crossed. :) We would definitely go back next time we go to Barcelona - especially now we know where everything is and how much it costs. Great holiday, can't wait to try other AC hotels in Italy and Portugal!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: socrates-junior
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are very clean, modern design. It was great that the mini bar was included in the price. The view from the room to the sea was very beaufiful. the receptionists were very helpful and nice. Having free wifi internet in the rooms would be apropriate for the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: king11_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within easy reach of city centre and beach. There is a bus turistic stop just outside (we had two day ticket to get around) and plenty of taxis outside also if required and other local buses. Taxi to airport averages 30 euros and only takes about 20 minutes. The hotel room was perfect (city view) with robe and slippers and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. Hotel next to Diagonal Mar Shopping Centre with the most wonderful shops inside and plenty of places to eat. Excellent fitness and spa facilities. Staff very helpful and excellent value for money and will definitely return to this modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommended with caveats”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Quiet street so no street noise. Shopping mall and Natural History Museum across street. Walking distance to sea, but not at all scenic. Two blocks to metro. Safe neighborhood. Taxis always available out front. Rooms are not huge, but not teeny-tiny like many European hotels. Mostly friendly staff. New, clean rooms and facility. Breakfast is not fantastic, but perfectly acceptable. Hotel attached to conference center, so it your business is there it's very convenient. Cons: Location a bit off of beaten track - not central to sites tourists would want to visit. No ironing board - none in room, none guests can borrow; must pay for cleaning/ironing service. Internet is free in lobby but very slow. Room phones don't connect to front desk, housekeeping, room service - at least mine didn't and there were no instructions on how to call inside hotel. Front desk understaffed - long waits at peak times. No dedicated concierge. Misc: 35-50 Euro taxi to or from airport. Entrance to hotel is not well marked - it's through the revolving door at corner of building.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Business Hotel - still good and recommended if you are in the area”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: Like many hotel chains, AC maintains a good standard in their hotels, which unfortunately also means that individuality is limited, especially when it comes to the rooms. For the AC Barcelona (Forum), the architecture at least is quite interesting as the hotel was build as part of the massive development for the Olympics. It is therefore close to the (new) beach, which it overlooks on the one side, while the city side offers views on the Sagrada Famiglia. The entrance hall and the bar on the first level are specifically interesting and well-designed. Also, there is one floor for the gym and wellness area including an outdoor pool (which could not be used in Feb, of course...). Overall, it's a good hotel and recommended IF you need to stay in the area. For visiting the city, more central places should be preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Great,super clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreeatorres
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , not in the center, but close to the seaside. Just a 10 min bus trip, also metro station is 1 min walk away.Buses very clean and safe. Very conveniently located across from a nice mall and plaza,so lots of dining places,and shopping options,nothing upscale thou!!!!. Impecably clean,neat and updated which in Europe you'll never find in city center for less than $ 300- 400Euros. Very nice gym and rooftop sauna and pool. In a nutshell, if you don't mind the 10 min trip to city center, is a 5 stars hotel for a great great price. Before i forget, great views of the entire city.Also, i was impressed with the people,very civil,comparing to Milan.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilfarufe
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location with a nearby shopping center and a lot of transport commodities to town center Very confortable room and nice see view from our room but : swimming pool not heated and hence closed in winter (only spa operating) no air condition (only heating operating) in winter (hence, even if heating is apparently switched off, opening windows is mandatory for a moderate room temperature with some substantial noise as a consequence ) no free internet expensive breakfast for two people (40€)

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cmullins66
Reviews.Content: The AC Barcelona looks smart, modern and 'hip'. It is out in the convention area so there is not much to do in the area other than visit the shopping mall opposite or attend a conference. Some of the hotel staff were lovely and professional but other staff came across as being bored and uninteresting. The room I stayed in was ok, smart, clean and had a swish bathroom with lots of free goodies. However there were a few niggles that were quite frustrating and became quite annoying during my stay. The plug socket in the bathroom was quite deep set and would not take my uk to euro plug adaptor. There was no plug socket next to the full length mirror, so hope less for ladies wanting to style their hair (like me..). There was only one plug socket next to the bed which did not function correctly so my phone was not charged overnight and the A/C did not work correctly. No free wireless either. Overall the hotel seemed to lack any kind of atmosphere. The bar was empty and the breakfast was uninspiring with staff who looked bored and uninterested. Whilst the hotel looks great and modern it just feels empty and slightly soul less and my stay was very boring. Due to a flight delay I ended up staying in a Hilton for an extra night and immediately felt more relaxed, more welcome and as though I understood the hotel. It is an ok hotel but I would not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: meexxx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to public transportation with a shopping mall across the street that had a lot of restaurants. At night, the room was very hot and stuffy. The hotel staff had already turned on the heat for winter, and the temperature outside didn't justify the heater. Room was very stuffy and hot. The staff offered a fan but then couldn't find one and would not consider doing anything else to alleviate the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but could do more.......”
Reviews.Author: Fasted09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my partner for the weekend in November. Hotel rooms are nice but extremely hot. It was so hot it was uncomfortable to sleep and the airconditioning in the room could not be adjusted as they have switched their central unit over to heating. Service at the reception was not the friendliest but they were not rude either. Just we had expected the staff to smile when they greet a guest. Maybe we were just unlucky or expected too much from them **being sarcastic** when checking in and out. Breakfast was ok nothing to rave about....Overall it was an ok hotel but I will not go back again. I would go back to the Princess or the Hilton hotel which is much better when I return to Barcelona again. The Princess and Hilton are only 2 minutes walking distance from the AC hotel. Will give this hotel a miss for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Rotten experience connected to thieft in their business center”
Reviews.Author: profjim1017
Reviews.Content: Went for a conference at the Barcelona Convention Center. Hotel service in general only OK - gave me a wake-up call about an hour after requested. No safe in the room. For-pay wireless in room spotty and slow. Business center off the lobby had free wireless, security cameras and a security guard in the lobby. I had my back pack at my feet and it was stolen. Mr. Security ran out onto the street but the thief was too far away. We lost 2 passports, my iphone, our camera, one credit card, money, several jump drives, keys to our car and home, important papers, etc. Essentially, the hotel staff did their best to ignore the situation. Offered to let me make two calls right after the incident - one to US Consulate and one to VISA. No help with the Spanish Police, getting passports, etc. Video evidence: they said they saw the guy, but wouldn't offer to let us take the tape to police. Ruined the whole visit - work and pleasure. We were treated very rudely by the desk Manager with a condescending manner near the departure time. I guess they figured we'd be gone and it wasn't their problem anymore. Wrote to the chain President who replied only in very general terms: Gee we're sorry it happened to you. The hotel manager followed with a response that said they did everything they could. Right. This hotel is on the edge of a bad neighborhood near the convention center. Many people at our conference were robbed around there and throughout town. I will certainly never stay at this hotel again, though I have been to Spain several times and will return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, BUT COULD BE A LOT BETTER”
Reviews.Author: limaje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AC for 4 nights. The plus point is the location as it was very convenient for us as we were attending a conference next door. There is also a metro station a short walk away with trains that take to you to the city centre. In addition, there is a wonderful mall opposite which was great for meals and shopping. The reception staff were friendly and professional. Our room was very clean, but it was uncomfortably warm. It was November and I believe the management turned the airconditioning off. We complained and the airconditioning start to work again 2 days later but mind you, only during the day. It was still very warm during evenings. The free mini-bar is great, but we were dissappointed that there are no tea/coffee making facilities and the hotel does not have an iron that guests could use. Little things like a box of tissue in our room and english speaking TV channels (apart from BBC news) would have made a difference. Cleaners and maintenance staff also have a habit of barging into our room without knocking first, which was rather annoying. All in all, its great if you need to be close to the conference centre, but I will not recommend it unless they change their policy on airconditioning.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: janetandbex
Reviews.Content: mother &daughter short break (ages 47& 20 yrs) wonderfull hotel with excellent facillities. We did not get to sight see as we intended because the weather & roof top pool was too good! Looking forward to a return visit next year.wonderfull sea view room despite only paying basic rate. great location for shopping .I would definately recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona & Me”
Reviews.Author: Administrato
Reviews.Content: Great, great memories & Nice place to stay, visited my places but i'm in love with Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, good beach location”
Reviews.Author: home2chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AC Forum Hotel Barcelona for 4 nights in October 2010. The hotel is a great choice if you want to be close to the beach or want to escape the crowds of La Ramblas and don't mind taking the metro to the other parts of the city. The Hotel - Check in was seamless and the room we were given had an excellent view of the sea. We found the staff to be very helpful in terms of arranging a hop-on, hop-off bus tour for us, and also making dinner reservations at a seafood restaurant. All the staff spoke excellent English. Beware of the jelly beans at the front desk...if you eat one, you'll be eating a lot more. They're terribly addicting! There is free wifi (it works very well) in the lobby and there is also a computer area with about 6 open pcs that you can use free of charge. The fitness facility on the 13th floor has an outstanding view of the coast. There is also a pool (with another great view) and 3 jacuzzi tubs for guests to use. I'd recommend a run on the jogging path that goes along the beach instead of a treadmill though. It's scenic, safe and provides a good place for a 4-5 mile run. The Room - Our room (Room 2003) was clean and spacious. It wasn't huge but large enough for 2 good sized suitcases with room leftover to move around comfortably. The bed was comfortable and we got a couple tv channels in English. The bathroom was impressive, as it was extremely clean and nice looking. The free mini bar was stacked with water bottles and several soft drinks everyday. This was a really nice extra after a long day of sighseeing. The hotel staff cleaned our room very well everyday. The Location - If you're interested in the beach, this hotel is an excellent choice. It is literally 5 mins walk to a very clean, uncrowded beach with fine golden sand. Be warned that it's not exactly a family atmosphere. As you walk down the beach, you will notice more and more people wearing less and less clothing. Having said that, I think Barcelona has some of the best beaches I've seen in Europe and would recommend it as a good beach destination. There are plenty of open showers for watering off after a swim and a good number of restaurants along the coastline. Directly across the hotel is a large shopping mall with cafes, restaurants and plenty of shops. If you want the bustle of Barcelona it's probably better to stay in the central part of town (close to La Ramblas or Sagrada Familia). Personally, we really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere of this hotel, the excellent location and the area surrounding it. We took the train to all the other areas of the city with no problems. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona as I feel it is a great choice and lives up to it’s 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and facilities - great staff and liesure facilities”
Reviews.Author: Mirela_Chelaru
Reviews.Content: I like the view from window to see the water, mini bar to use for free , rooms are big , clean , close to tehe beach , quiet , beautiful design

Reviews.Title: “A very modern hotel with a great location close to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Vinifico
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently and loved the hotel. It's large, modern, clean and close to the beach and a Metro station to get you to all of Barcelona's sights. We had a nice modern room overlooking the Mediterranean for 3 nights and had no complaints. The bar on the 1st floor (2nd floor for us North Americans) was great and any service request we had from the staff were handled immediately. The two negatives I'd like to point out are: * that for the 20 Euros, the breakfast (which wasn't included in our stay) was a bit of a rip-off, but we chose to try once anyway. I'd suggest you skip it and head into town to a cafe. * the lack of free high-speed Internet in the rooms was a pain. There was free Wi-Fi in the lobby, but that wasn't too convenient. The 12 Euro charge per day for Wi-Fi in the room was too steep. Other than that, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel close to beach”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_in_London_10
Reviews.Content: Overall spotless hotel with good facilities and within easy walk to the beach & local shopping centre (Diagonal Mar) for a range of restaurants/shopping/cafe's. We chose to walk into central Barcelona which took approximately 1 hour at a gentle pace. The room was slightly cluttered but well equipped. However, the value for money was marginally questionable compared to other comparable facilities. In summary a good score of 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and nice room”
Reviews.Author: ahooger
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near large mall and about 10 minutes drive by bus to city center. Hotel has a great swimming pool at 13th floor. Stayed half business half pleasure with wife and 9 year old son.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Barcelona and stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: steveatlanta1
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a beautiful city and so is this hotel. The hotel is very modern and the rooms are very smart and sophisticated, as well as comfortable and clean. I had a room overlooking the Sea. It was beautiful. I felt fortunate to get this room because I actually opted for the lowest rate. So, this was nice. As another reviewer mentioned, there is a lot of construction and you can hear the noise but it wasn't horrible. It didn't detract from the over all experience. The hotel is definitey not in the touristy area but that didn't bother me. You can walk down to the center along the Sea but it is a long walk. I did it once and enjoyed it. The metro is right by the hotel so there is no problem reaching all the major areas. I didn't interact a lot with the hotel staff but the few times I did, they were very courteous. What I really liked was the fact that I got to the hotel at 10:00 A.M. and my room was ready. When you travel ten hours to get somewhere, that is very much appreciated. The beaches right around the hotel are crowded but that didn't bother me. There was ample room to put a towel down. The view from the pool deck is great. I didn't swim but liked to go up there in the morning to take pictures. The mall across the street is very handy and it is nice if you want to grab a quick snack. Kudos to the hotel for offering a free mini bar service. What hotel does that? None, that I have ever been to and I've been to hundreds in my lifetime. Breakfast was OK but a little over-priced. But the mini bar made up for it. I only had six days in Barcelona and wish I would have had ten days minimum. That is how great the city is.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my 10 night stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NedA7
Reviews.Content: I wanted a compromise between the culture of the city centre and the joy of laying in the Barcelona sunshine. The AC Barcelona fitted the bill perfectly. A friendly, very efficient hotel that is clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms are very well appointed in green marble and contain luxury fittings. The hotel pool situated on the 13th floor was disappointingly small and access to sunbeds out of the question. The quirky 'El Parc Forum' is a short 400m walk from the hotel and provided ideal sunbathing facilities. I hope to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, shopping mall, and close to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: CaKanoe
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I spent 4 days at the AC Barcelona at the end of our trip so I could attend a conference. It is located in an industrial area away from the heart of the city but it worked for us. It is close to the beach and even though it is not the best beach, it was swimmable and enjoyable. it also has a great area to skateboard with a small park and concessions nearby along side the port. When we arrived, 1800hotels had cancelled our reservation because it just went out of business unknowing to us. The hotel researched what happened and said they would honor our internet rate but we would have to pay again. They called my credit card company collect and I was able to get the original charged removed as i stood at the check in counter. We had to wait about 45 minutes but we did get it settled and the staff was fantastic and supportive. They gave us a room on the 22nd floor with an incredible view of the city and Sagrada Familia in the background. The hotel is very clean and spatious. We slept well here. They also provide free drinks in the fridge. My son loved this feature. The bathroom was very large and stylish. The 13th floor has a very nice breakfast buffet daily that we enjoyed as part of our hotel cost. There is a small pool with jacuzzi and sauna that my son also used alot. You can get drinks and food there but it is a bit on the pricey side. Across the street is a huge shopping mall with many boutiques and places to eat. There is one place to get Euros with your atm. The metro is a block away and very convenient to sightseeing. We were warned about pick pockets outside the hotel but we never encountered any. I wore a money belt. We actually took the metro and the aerobus to the airport at 5:30am in the morning and had nt problems except for a bit of rain!!! All in all, we really liked this hotel for its modern conveniences and helpful staff. There are also free individual safe boxes behind the check in counter that were very easy to use. If you don't mind a bit of an industrial area with an adjacent beach and shopping mall to keep you busy, this is the hotel for you. You may want to stay a couple of days in the heart of the city just to experience it and then the rest of the time here. We found great rates online.

Reviews.Title: “High standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: hvaarala
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in Barcelona. Clearly business class hotel (new and high standard hotel). Maybe a bit far away from the down-town but metro station is nearby as well as a big shopping center. Great gym at 13th floor, including swimming pool with sea-view.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I have ever been at, which covers about 500 hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Jcbezdek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights because it was the conference hotel chosen by our professional society for its annual conference. During the 7 days, about 15 people were robbed either IN the hotel, or at large in Barcelona. My best friend had his backpack stolen while he worked at a computer in the hotel lobby. The backpack was on the floor, about 12" from his foot. This incident was captured by the hotel security camera. He lost his passport and miscellaneous items (cell phone, camera, etc.), and this hotel did not even offer to take him to the consulate to replace his passport. When he asked to use the phone to call the police, the hotel informed him that they would charge the call to his room. Then, they refused to release anything to him about it so he could file an insurance claim for his losses. As for me? I tried to take a plate of food from their breakfast room across the hall to the room that our ADCOM meeting was being held one morning (which also had these plates, but only donuts). They literally screamed at me that I could not remove anything from the breakfast area, even though I could SEE stacks of identical plates 30 feel away. Wake up calls were consistently late. One day a knock at my door let me know that they missed it - by 45 minutes ! Better late than never? Not when you are depending on it. This reflects the basic attitude of this hotel - who cares? Not them. DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL, AND IF YOU CAN SKIP BARCELONA, DO IT.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CHOICE, GREAT 13TH FLOOR!”
Reviews.Author: Pipinho
Reviews.Content: Located near the beach in the new financial district. Around the hotel you have parks, a conference center, more hotels and some shopping centers. Right in front of the hotel there is a bus stop and a stall for bicycles, which you can park all over town. A stylish hotel with good presentation, wide entrance and with free internet. There is a restaurant and a bar. The best of the hotel is on the 13th floor: Spa, jacuzzi, sauna, gym, bar and an outdoor pool all with great taste and with spectacular views of Barcelona and the coast. Divine! The hotel charges for parking but you manage to find parking space on the streets surrounding the hotel very easily. Hotel workers were very friendly and helpful. I found a good babysitter through the reception at € 20.00 an hour. Animals are allowed but there is a charge. Ten-minute walk to beaches; the water is warm but they are always full, so if you have a car it is better to drive a few kilometers to find more quiet and beautiful beaches. The hotel is a 5-10 minutes drive to downtown. To go out at night there are bars at the hotels or the shopping center. If you want more action you should go to the city center. Although not cheap, it is worth the Euros paid. If you make reservations through the hotel’s website in advance you may get good prices. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay, contemporary, clean and quiet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sommartider_2008
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anybody, especially the bar/lounge/gym/outdoor pool area on the 13th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Not my choice”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: Attended a two day meeting here so had no say in the choice of hotel. Hotel is kind of ok - it's not my cup of tea at all in that it's big and impersonal and corporate, but it kind of worked, the staff were good, breakfast was good, bedroom was a bit spartan and soul-less. Worst thing really is location, in a god-forsaken building-site suburb of the city undergoing massive high-rise industrial development. Constant drone of construction machinery even on the upper floors of the hotel. If coming to Barcelona on a romantic break you do not want to stay around here.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel slippers ever!”
Reviews.Author: kmd74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in January 2009 during a business trip to Barcelona. I had a large room on the 15th floor overlooking the harbour. Both the lounge / bedroom and bathroom were very spacious and well-appointed - there was even a separate dressing room area off the bathroom. It was too cold to try the pool but the gym was great and I enjoyed using the treadmill while watching the sun rise over the ocean. A very stylish hotel in an ideal location for the conference centre but probably not so good for tourists. Breakfast included lots of healthy options. The complimentary hotel slippers are the best I've ever come across - they have spongey soles - this may sound frivolous but they are definitely worth taking home!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base of operations for Primavera Sound festival goers and a quality hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Mooger
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at AC Barcelona with my wife. While the layout of the building and the rooms were a carbon copy of the many 4-star hotels we stayed at previously, the quality was also up to par. The differences mainly concerned a great 32" LCD TV set with a nice selection of programs, a completely free minibar and an unwelcome absense of a safe/safety deposit box in the room. The hotel is located in a modern business district of Barcelona. I really love this part of the city actually for its adventurous hi-tech architecture (the talles buildings of Barcelona are here), quietness and fresh air. The metro station is only a 5 minutes walk, there's also a tram for those with claustrophobia. It only takes about 20 to 30 minutes to get to the center of the city by metro and it's a pleasant 20 minute tram trip to the city Zoo and the beaches and restaurants of Ciutadella vila Olimpica. For us the main attraction of AC Barcelona was its closeness to Parc del Forum, a popular festival site. I belive that for festival goers this is a perfect base of operations and it beats any other hotel or apartment located in the center. I can't comment on other services like fitness center, restaraunt or a swimming pool, since we never used those.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel - walking distance to the beach”
Reviews.Author: lizz1155
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located approximately 20-25 minutes from Barcelona airport (by taxi), in the business district of Barcelona. It is 10 minutes walk from a clean, sandy beach. It is also located opposite a large shopping centre, which proved to be very useful for food shopping, since the quality of the food served in the hotel restaurant was disappointing (the menu sounded nice, but the food seemed simply 'reheated', and even then not very hot... or pleasant...). The mini bar in the bedroom was free and well-stocked, but there are no tea and coffee making facilities, which I would have preferred. The hotel seemed clean and tidy, with modern artwork in the reception. The hotel is 'english friendly', with the majority of the staff speaking good english - also most of the hotel 'literature' has a translation for english speaking guests. The bedrooms were tidy and cleaned on a daily basis. For an 'out-of-town' hotel the location is good; the spires of the Sagrada Familia can be seen from the window, however the main tourist attractions are definately not within walking distance. There is a bus stop for the Barcelona Tour Bus just across the street, a taxi rank outside the door of the hotel, and a tram line nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy rooms; indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: movedbydesire
Reviews.Content: Booked a room three weeks in advance without using an advanced booking discount - hoped our room preferences would be fulfilled - non-smoking, sea-view, double bed. Nevertheless, when we were checking in, they offered us either a room on a smoking floor with a sea view or a non-smoking room with a city view. After some wrangling, they found a non-smoking room with a sea view, but with twin bed. So three weeks is not enough to reserve a desired room. The room was small and most likely equipped for a single occupant - we found only one set of slippers and one bath-robe. It took us several phone calls and a personal visit to the reception to get the second set. Furthermore, we were not advised that there was a construction right at the sea side of the hotel. So, next morning 7 am we were woke up by some kind of a rock-drill. The conditioning system didn't work properly - the air was always very stuffy. We asked for a technician; he came, switch off the conditioner and suggested us to open the window (remember the construction outside the window)! Finally, when we were checking out, they asked which currency we would like to pay on credit card - Euro or our local. I chose the local. After coming home I realized that they add 2% to the conversion rate - the fact we were not informed about! Cheating as it is! So, be warn. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: babybecky
Reviews.Content: very well situated just next to the forum, congress center. Not so well situated if the aim of the trip is sightseeing or shopping. extremely comfortable rooms and beds, with all facilities you could expect from a top 4 stard hotel + nicely decorated Weak point: no wi fi in bedrooms. There is an internet room near the reception. Good service. Good buffet breakfast. Was one night for dinner at the hotel restaurant: not spectacular food. lovely roof terrace with swimming pool / jacuzzi, fitness

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but skimp on too many details for the price”
Reviews.Author: DumptruckMotorcade
Reviews.Content: The rooms at AC are nice, tidy and modern. Location is convenient for the Diagonal Mar shopping centre, but otherwise the neighbourhood is very boring. As for dining it's best to go out. The restaurants are scorchingly expensive. Over €21 for an unremarkable breakfast buffet is not my idea of value. And after a flight in to Barcelona, do hope your dress shirts don't get wrinkled in your luggage because the hotel will not provide you with an iron or ironing board. They'll gladly press your shirts for €5.50. What a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Forum Area”
Reviews.Author: Turistico2010
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with good facilities. Nice room. Only negatives are that the sauna and steam rooms were closed when I went there after 9pm, and my room didn't have a safe.

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: Sandyd1234
Reviews.Content: Location was great for the business trip I was on, but is away from the city center. Transportation is readily available though, so not a huge challenge. The room I stayed in was very small and the furniture was falling apart. I would rate this a 2 star hotel at best. However, the breakfast buffet they provided was very good, although a little pricey (20 euro). Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Read for hotel and Barcelona review”
Reviews.Author: Canuckontheroad87
Reviews.Content: Location: Southeast corner of city away from main sites. However, near a subway which is easy to navigate. Right across the street from a shopping mall with a grocery and Starbucks. Cost: I was charged $100 for first 3 nights, the receivced the "conference rate" of $185. Not sure how that worked out. Not bad price I guess for a European hotel Facility: Clean and modern, rooms are smaller but adequate. Mini bar was stocked with some beer, juice and water complimentary which was nice. To get ice was tricky and was delivered with a $4.00 service charge - a bit annoying. No safe in room which was a concern as we were warned about theft. However, nothing was stolen and housekeeping staff seem very professional. Service: Front desk were very helpful and friendly as was the bar guy and housekeeping. One manager/super really ticked me off when he insisted I was late for our per-paid buffet and wanted me to go pay at the restaurant. Overall: a decent hotel, I do not have a comparison as this was my only trip to BCN. Barcelona: Great city - lots of history. People generally friendly despite their economic hardships right now. Unemployment is currently 30% and theft including mugging and purse-snatching is up. So you have to be smart about how you travel and where you go. Subways and public areas are generally safe. Don't dangle the bills or the purse. Subway system is very efficient, clean and inexpensive. Food is tyipcal Mediterranean with lots of seafood (squid etc), tapas (small dishes of various meats, sandwiches etc). If you are not an adventurous eater, this might not be for you. Our best and cheapest meal was at a place on the pier ($65 Euro for 2 with a bottle of wine). The "all-inclusive" meal deals seem to be the best (ie. $15 for appetizer, main and dessert). Finally, TC Barcelona soccer game is a MUST. 96,000 people in one place and no one getting out of hand (no booze sold in stadium). Also, Park Guell and the tram on MontJuic are a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a Nice, Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: franz85
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the AC Barcelona back in September 2009. We had just disembarked from a cruise and stayed here for three days before we flew home. As we had to be off the ship by 8:00 am, we were very concerned that we would not be able to check in. Upon arriving the staff were super accommodating and allowed us to check early. Our room was clean and comfortable. The frosted glass door to the bathroom took a little bit to get used to. We really appreciated the free mini bar in our room - it was great to receive water, pop and beer each day. Our reservation included daily breakfast - I highly recommend this option if it available. The breakfasts were delicious and offered a fairly good variety. The pool is on the 13th floor. It's quite small and there were not a lot of lounge chairs, but the views of Barcelona from up there are absolutely amazing. The free computer and internet access in the business centre was definitely a bonus as we wanted to keep in touch with our friends and family back home. The staff even allowed us to use their printer to print our boarding passes. The hotel is definitely not close to many of the main attractions (ie: Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas, etc). I recommend purchasing a one or two day ticket from Barcelona Bus Turistic. These buses allow you to "hop on or hop off" as many times as you want and will take you directly into the heart of Barcelona. There is a bus stop directly in front of the AC Barcelona.
