There is also a shopping mall across the street. Great shopping and quite a few good restaurants. Perfect if you want to grab a quick meal after a long day of touring around. Lastly, there is an awesome beach just two and a half blocks away from the hotel. It took us probably 10 minutes to walk there. We definitely enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a contemporary yet quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie2203
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days whilst on conference, wish I had been on a higher floor as my only view was the back of the conference centre. The rooms were well kitted out with tv and stereo system and free minibar. Beds were comfy and staff were very friendly. Security was excellent and on the day my key card did not work the maid did not just open the door for me she called down to reception to check that I was the guest residing in that room. Lovely bathroom and modern decor. I do not know if this was a regular occurrence but the lobby bar closed early every night that we were theremeaning we had to order room service after midnight. great for business travel but not for a holiday

Reviews.Title: “Staff not Helpful - I was forced to stay here”
Reviews.Author: netcaretaker
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the only time I got the staff's attention was when I got the luggage cart and started to go up to my room and get my own luggage. The reason I was doing this was because they told me they would not go get my luggage. When they stopped me and told me I could not use the carrier, I told them I was not bring down my 4 pieces of luggage in 2 trips (for my wife and I). I also like the fact that when I checked out they charged me in US dollars and not Euros, and they charged me an exchange rate that was $0.22 over what I would have gotten from my credit card if they would have charged me in Euros. Room was small, even for Europe, bed was very uncomfortable, tv was like 20 years old and the wifi sucked - dial up speeds most of the time and the printer never worked even though several people attempted to use it, the staff just said, ya, it does not work.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & good shopping nearby”
Reviews.Author: jondeb2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a top secret hotel on lastminute. Did research so knew what I was getting. Hotel is very modern, free mini bar and good faciltiies. Very good shopping centre and food court / reataurants over the road made meals easy. Hotel is a little way out but metro is nearby, very conventient. Get a carnet of 10 trips on the metro, and head out for the day. It was nice to leave the bustle of central barca and return to the hotel at the end of of each day. Barcelona was good as ever. Found a nice bar called milk that had good food, cheap drink and comfy sofas. We were here for new year and walked along the beach one day from Barcelonetta to the hotel - took about an hour at a leisurely pace.

Reviews.Title: “As it was...”
Reviews.Author: TheGooseDublin
Reviews.Content: 1. Rooms are way too warm 2. The hotel is too big to give a personal service if that is what you are after 3. Its not so central, tram and metro to centre in about 20-25 mins. 4. Spa services are awful, as in not what I like. The sauna rooms are tinyand claustrophobic, and the jacuzzis are dirty and not warm. For such a large hotel also, the facilities are tiny so the Spa is always over crowded... 5. Didnt try breakfast but did have coffee room service which was good but it was WAY overpriced... 6. The rooms for me tried too hard without having anything of substance. A stereo with no CDs for example, bathroom was the best part, big and clean and had a large bath... however, the bathroom door is glass with no frame, so privacy is non existant! 7. its a new hotel and staff by the look of things, so knowledge of the area was lacking and sparse... they didnt know a tram went to centre from around the corner for example... kind of important. The staff at the desk also didnt acknowledge people walking in, not that its expected, but from a security point of view, that doesnt bode well, anyone could be getting up and around the hotel floors and rooms... 8. There are 4 computers in the lobby with free internet, but not virus protected, so be careful if you are accessing email and facebook or you'll be phished! 9. Sea view but only if you are up on high, otherwise you see industrial looking stuff. Its also not near the beach... you can see the beach! but you cannot walk easily to it.... 10. Double rooms consist of twin beds that move apart because they are on wooden floors... 11. The electricity blew in our room, okay maybe a once off as its a new hotel but still, it doesnt inspire confidence in the hotel... 12. It was easy to get a cab outside which was great, about 10\12 Euro to centre. 13. On the tram\metro, the tickets you get are not combined, so its more expensive overall on tram and metro to get to centre, taxi is easier and quicker- 14. Free mini bar BUT, only has water, some coke\fanta and 2 San Miguel beers (small!) Overall I wouldnt recommend, its not a 4 Star hotel and it tries too hard. As a preference a smaller hotel, more central with a more personal service would be better. You would save money on transport and also you run less risk of passing out in your room from the heating levels! : )

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too warm.................”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: We were due to sail from Barcelona on a cruise, but the boat was delayed by a day. We were put up in this hotel for the night by the cruise company - all 500 of us! It took 3 hours of queing outside for us to be checked in by the 3 staff on reception. This was not the fault of the hotel, but the cruise company certainly did not have an adequate contingency plan in case of a delay on this scale. In total 2,500 passengers were put in hotels at 2 hours notice. It is a very nice hotel, beautiful room but NO flat screen tv, and possibly the best bathroom I have seen in a long while - Black/Green marble and lots of chrome, but once you use the clear GLASS sink all the water marks are horrible. beautiful but not practical! Lots of thoughtful little additions for the travellers use. It was warm 22c and the hotel was too hot..............................air conditioning was on, but not functioning. We opened a window - only slightly because it was fixed that way and we were on the 10th floor. Really was too hot to sleep much. Next day we heard that the air con was switched off because it isn´t summer!! Breakfast buffet was very good, staff were very helpful and smart in appearance. Tables cleared quickly and always with a smile. Excellent shopping mall across the street - and air conditoning works there!

Reviews.Title: “'We will not be turning on the air conditioning in the hotel'?!”
Reviews.Author: waterstone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business (I usually stay in the city center, but the meetings were at the AC Barcelona so the client booked me there as well). Generally fine for my purposes--room was clean, bed comfortable, etc.--as I spent much of the day out of the room. However, it was very warm, even after closing the blinds and curtains and instructing housekeeping staff to keep them that way. The air conditioning didn't work, so I called down to the front desk to see what could be done. The young woman politely told me what it says in the title, and suggested that I open the window (which I had already done). I was a bit taken aback. Is this what cost-cutting in Spain has come to? Also, there was no offer to move me to another room. I won't be coming back to this hotel if I have a choice (again, not because the hotel is horrible but because it is fairly basic and a bit inconvenient to the city center). I will be cautioning anyone who inquires about this hotel about their air-conditioning policy, though.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: taylorau
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days and we both found the staff extremely helpful and the room great. We would most definately stay there again if we were to return to Barcelona. Really easy to get into town with trams, buses and trains close by. Have already recommended the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel close to conference centre but also good for tourists”
Reviews.Author: kitikatz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, the conferenece centre is just behind the hotel, literally 2 minutes walk. Cool reception area and design features throughout. Apparently there is a rooftop pool but i didn't have a chance to check this out. Had to take cabs into the centre, so not great for being in the heart of the city but a clean, friendly and useful location if you are on business. If you are a tourist who likes to be able to leave the hustle and bustle, then this is going to suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: sjo1966
Reviews.Content: Asked for a top floor room, away from lift shaft and with sea-view. Got a room on 21st floor (out of 22), facing the mountain and not near the lift shaft. Modern room. Free minibar which contained 2 x small beer (1 non-alcoholic), 2 x water & 3 fizzy drinks (all small sizes) but welcome that it was included in the room. Breakfast at the weekend was on special offer at €9 plus tax/ea - would have been disappointed if paying normal rate (€20+tax) but everything was fresh and replenished quickly. There's a shopping centre opposite which has plenty of more simple and cheaper options. The underground is round the corner and buses and trams you fall onto outside the door so the out of town location is not an issue. This is a business hotel but was great value for money and you can leave your bags for the day when you check out. Staff were friendly. Rooms small, bathrooms ok and large sizes of complimentary shampoo etc. Used the gym which has great views over the sea and the equipment, although limited. was just as good as our gym at home. Great place for the pool but despite outside temps of 25 degC it was too chilly to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelnPea
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed not only with the decor of the hotel, but also the staff were excellent in fielding requests for dinner and help navigating the city. I even had to have one excellent front desk guy to park my car and unpark it from the garage. (I am a novice stick shift driver!!) The only thing the was not totally up to par were the whirlpools in the fitness center, water was cloudy and appeared dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest Staff”
Reviews.Author: EvaHaw
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner stayed at the AC,, its a 4 star nice clean hotel,, but what good is that if you can't trust the cleaning staff!!!! I left a bag at the hotel room in the closet I rang on returning home to hear they had a bag and would return it to me,, I was delighted and then recieved an email sayin that there was only cream in the bag,, the bag I left had clothing with tags on worth €200. after many calls and emails I was basically told there was no bag and nothing can be done. It is clear to me that one of the staff stole the bag seeing the clothing in it. I'm sick that this can happen in a 4 star hotel and that they act like they don't even give a hoot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AC Barcelona is the best venue for quiet resting”
Reviews.Author: talaris
Reviews.Content: ac²barcelona is a quiet, comfortable hotel with an incredible view on Barcelona at high floors..... modern decoration, very good service, polite andf efficient staff, it's the ideal place for good time in spain

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and stylish”
Reviews.Author: sacoripa
Reviews.Content: Perfect acommodation and easy accessible, great service and nice people. To be recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice BUT slightly over-rated by most!!”
Reviews.Author: OnlyTheBestPlease
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute holiday for 5 nights before my baby bump got too big to fly!! We chose this hotel as it was recommended by a friend and was not in the centre of Barcelona but had good links to the centre. . . The Hotel: - Reception looks nice, modern, contemporary, sharp and clean (good first impression until you see the trailing wires of all the lamps and fixtures - some of us have an eye for detail!) - Room was smaller than expected but adequate, wardrobe and chest drawers were ample and we got the sea view we requested. TV unfortunately was all Spanish except for CNN and the minibar is free and reasonably stocked daily with Coke, Diet Coke, Fanta, Diet Fanta, 2 x Water, 2 x San Miguel (Beer). The bed wasn't as comfy as I'd heard but then I was 5.5 months pregnant so it could've been that messing with my sleep! The two down falls of the room --> NO tea/coffee making facilities, NO Iron/Ironing Board - Bathroom the hotel provided 1 gown, 1 pair of slippers, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, soap, 1 toothbrush with sachet of paste, 1 razor with sachet of gel and comb. - Restaurant/Breakfast - never used these facilities as they were extortionate prices and very bad for vegetarians!! - 13th Floor outside pool, jacuzzi, etc - was lovely to lounge around out here but did get full quick and the bar service is horrendous!!! Took almost 40 mins for them to make 1 Pina Colada and Vanilla Milkshake!!! So if you order something don't wait at the bar for it, go sun bathe and go back for it half hour later!!! The pool was freezing cold despite the lovely weather which was very disappointing but my husband had the advantage that he was able to use the indoor jacuzzi, steam room and sauna. . . Steam Room and Sauna again are small but then there are 3 jacuzzi's!! Staff - Diego on reception was brilliant!!!! He gave us a map, helped us find a place to eat and was generally extremely helpful! Location - Great to be away from it all!: - Opposite a big shopping mall with plenty of places to eat (as long as you're not a lacto-vegetarian), a supermarket and plenty of ice-cream places too!! - 500m from the beach which is great, naturist so expect an eyeful!), not loaded with tourists and has some great bars with music playing and food available!! - Bus stop opposite hotel for 20min ride into city centre (catalunya) or metro round the corner but we never felt the need for that - Sight Seeing Bus Tour stop is also right outside the hotel so no need to travel anywhere else before joining!! - Peaceful area, felt safe!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect for a weekend away”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledKW
Reviews.Content: Having literally just returned from my stay at AC BArcelona I can vouch that the hotel lives up to expectations. Although it is not in the city centre It is well positioned to both metro and bus. By metro it takes 10-15 minutes to get to las rambla and 5 to the Olympic port which boasts some of the best nightclubs I have ever been to. We paid very little for this 4* hotel and it was great value for money. Having stated in some amazing hotels around the world this is well worth it - the roof top pool is fantastic (although you will need to wake early to get a sunbed there are only 8 for the entire hotel). The pool has views across the city, including the beach, mountains and the world rebound gaudi cathedral. The food is good quality excellent breakfast for 15euros and room service is reasonable (9-16 euros). The complementary mini bar was also well recieved - plus as there is a shopping mall directly opposite the hotel you can pop to the supermarket for a decent red wine!!! Barcelona is a romantic and wildly fun place to be with an abundance of great shopping, excellent restaurants and vast culture but whether my next visit to barcelona be with my boyfriend or Girly mates (as it was this time) I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Get the ear plugs ready”
Reviews.Author: roverthemoon_9
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly a luxury hotel and well worth the price we paid. However the superb view and excellent facilities were unfortunately spoilt on Saturday evening through lack of sleep caused by the incessant noise coming from the adjacent Barcelona Forum which was being used for a Music Festival. My partner and I were kept awake until 4am. The hotel seemed to be well aware of this problem as they had a large supply of earplugs at hand but hardly an adequate solution for its guests. How the local authority can sanction a music festival of this type so late into the early hours in what is a business/tourist district is beyond belief as this would not be permitted in the UK. Not sure how often these music events take place but its worth asking the question when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Some of your employee's were rude, on the 13th flr cafe.”
Reviews.Author: garozzie
Reviews.Content: I was there for seven days and the people at the front desk were very short temper with the customers and there was a big convention going on maybe you should schedule different people to work different shift not the same people working all the time. I will never stay there again and will not be recommending anyone there.

Reviews.Title: “your staff is not up to the job”
Reviews.Author: therealpicasso
Reviews.Content: bad service, unskilled staff. Didn't feel well treated. The cafeteria at the pool level is under staffed and you have to wait long to be attended. They don't speak english and they don't speak catalan either. Not even in the reception. You get the feeling that people are not happy to be working there. It's sad.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,stylish and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: dawesy69
Reviews.Content: From the airport it took 20 mins and cost 25 euro,immaculate taxis.The hotel is very clean and modern looking.The room on the 10th floor had amazing views of the sea.The room had all the toiletries,so no need to take anything as they get re-stocked when they nearly run out. The mini bar is free and gets re-stocked every morning.The beds and pillows are very comfy.The only downside is the air condition.It all depends on the day outside as it draws the air in.The room can become smelly,so what we did was turn it off and open the window when in the room,then when leaving turn it on to keep the room cool.It is not the hotels fault its just because of the air outside,this i noticed in other places in barcelona.We had breakfast included,done through (low cost holidays) works out alot cheaper,the food was very good indeed and caters for everyones needs.Across the road is the biggest shopping mal in the city.Lots of shops,cafes and restaurants.We ate everynight in the open air restaurants above the shopping mal, the " casa del pescado" is a good one.The paella is great nearly 14 euros each,min 2 persons.The metro is 100 yards "El Maresme".Get the T10 ticket it lasts for 10 journeys and multiple people can use it as we thought it was for 1 person only.It saves loads of money.It can be used throughout the city, as the city is classed as being 1 zone.It costs just over 7 euros.Park Guell and Casa Batello are a must see.The beach is 300 yards away and is very very clean,when in the sea the sea sparkles like its got gold glitter in, due to the sand.If planning to go to Sagrada Familia we would recommend you get there when it opens otherwise you could be waiting in a queue for way over an hour in the baking heat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, Modern, Great Staff, Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Keera03
Reviews.Content: Believe me, you will not be disappointed with this establishment. From the time you walk in you receive the highest level of customer service. The lobby, rooms, restaurant...the entire hotel overall is very modern. The beds are extremely comfortable, nice furniture in the suties, 40 inch + flat screen tvs, marble in the bathrooms, and great views from the room. The pool and weight room are lovely. I just don't know what else can be said. This would be one of my top choices of hotels for business or pleasure when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic but not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: sardo-gallego_couple
Reviews.Content: I report the review given by another traveller with some corrections: Me and my partner went to Barcelona in july 2009, and stayed for 2 days. We chose AC Barcelona Hotel because all the hotels in Barcelona were fully booked. Check-in was fast and the receptionists were very friendly. This hotel is not primary for tourists, but for business travellers. The hotel is quite far from city center, but not far from the nearest metro (that will take you to Las Ramblas in 7-10 min). ***Excellent area for chilling and sunbathing/beach.*** There is a BIG mall on the other side of the street, where you can buy drinks/food etc. The hotel have a minibar and you can keep your drinks cold. I think the minibar is free of charge! Excellent! However the hotel kitcken serves excellent food (although at a price!!) There is also a roof with a SPA, outdoor swimmingpool, sitting areas and drinks. And the view of Barcelona from the roof is amazing! It is surrounded by highways, which makes it a bit noisy. Not that much though. Conclusion: + High rise hotel - good view + Large room, nice bathroom and minibar + Close to the beach (4-5 min walking) + Next to large shopping mall + Free use of swimmingpool, jacuzzi and the roof terrace + The staff speaks many languages including italian, spanish, english, french and german - Quite far (about 1 hour walking/ 10 min with metro) from city center - Breakfast NOT included - Business hotel (not for turists..) - Expensive! - A bit noisy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dollars1996
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a toursit trap! The people are not helpful, we had to wait for our room after the check in time, the room was narrow and small. The front desk guy gave use very bad directions 3 times and the hot water from the shower was soooo hot, it burned! Like may of the cities in Spain, merchants wanted cash only. Everyone..... I mean everyone we encounted in this city, just didnt care! We saw hookers, naked people and beer pushers walking the street. Where is the police here? Even the folks at the AVE station were bad...... We missed our train, messing with these folks. Thus we were forced to buy more tickets at an additional $362! Do youself a favor and avoid this hotel & city...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kasty21
Reviews.Content: Hi, I pondered for 3 months over which hotel to pick, as it was a surprise for my boyfriends birthday. In the end i went on last minute.com and chose the TOP SECRET HOTEL, so i did not have a clue.I got the AC Barcelona, and thought NICE!!! I stayed here for 3 nights Friday 12th-Monday 15th. When i first arrived i was advised i did not have a sea view (even though i was advised by email). So the 1st night we were on level 6. The room was nice, just what i expected as it was a standard room, not with all the bells and whistles. The next day they arranged for me and my boyfriend to go into room 2211-sea view on level 22. The room was the same (nice) but the view was lovely. The cleaners were very friendly, although they dont speak much english (to be fair they are in Spain not England, we wouldnt speak a foreign language if they came here). The bathroom is lovely, not a spot of dust or dirt in sight in the whole place, including the hotel. You get a free mini bar which includes-2 tumbler glasses-bottle opener,2 still water,2 fizzy water,2 non alcoholic beers, 2 san miguel,coke and fanta. The TV is what you would expect foreign channels, with english CNN. The tour busses for the green line stop right outside, Metro pretty close. Walk along the beach to the port (7 euros in a taxi). The pool area is just amazing. Overall i thought the hotel was lovely and i really enjoyed my stay, i have stopped in some of the most expensive hotels, and this was just as nice for the amount i paid. I am back in the UK now-Dull-Rainy and boring, i would go back to AC Barcelona in a flash, it was GREAT :-) It was so worth the pondering. xx

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not for turists...”
Reviews.Author: lucky-duck28
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went to Barcelona in july 2008, and stayed for 3 days. We chose AC Barcelona Hotel because it's location to the beach (about 4-5 min walking - very close!). Check-in was fast, but the receptionist was kinda snobby. This hotel is not primary for tourists, but for business travelers. The hotel is quite far from city center, but not far from the nearest metro (that will take you to Las Ramblas in 7-10 min). ***Excellent area for chilling and sunbathing/beach.*** There is a BIG mall on the other side of the street, where you can buy drinks/food etc. The hotel have a minibar and you can keep your drinks cold. I think the minibar is free of charge! Excellent! There is also a roof with a SPA, outdoor swimmingpool, sitting areas and drinks. And the view of Barcelona from the roof is GOOD! Conclusion: + High rise hotel - good view + Large room, nice bathroom and minibar + Close to the beach (4-5 min walking) + Next to large shopping mall + Free use of swimmingpool, jacuzzi and the roof terrace + The staff speak english - Quite far (about 1 hour walking/ 10 min with metro) from city center - Breakfast NOT included - Business hotel (not for turists..) - Expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona...”
Reviews.Author: Simmone
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break at the AC barcelona. After reading some of the other reviews i was a little apprehensive however we had a great stay there. The location is a little out of the way for tourist attractions but there are excellent transport links - the tourist bus and the tram both stop across the street and the metro is a few minutes walk away - the olympic village is about 4-5 stops away with some fab beach restaurants and bars and the ramblas about 7-8 stops. The location is fairly residential and definitely safe with lots of families around - there is a great community feel with people rollerblading, skateboarding and biking and a nice playground for kids. We had a good walk around and there is a nice little marina and beach nearby but I think a lot of the surrounding area was specifically built for the olympic games and doesn't appear to be used anymore? There is a cluster of hotels all together - AC barcelona, barcelona princess, diagonal zero and the hilton diagonal mar however this hotel seemed to be the best value. The lobby of the hotel is quite impressive with over-sized structural furniture pieces The room was fine - the only gripe would be that we had requested a double room which was actually two singles pushed together - would have much preferred a double bed. I thought the amenities were quite good - slippers, bathrobe, tissues, shampoo, conditioner, razor & shaving cream, toothbrush and toothpaste. The free mini bar was a nice touch too - you get 2 x san miguels, coke, diet coke, fanta orange, fanta limon, and still and sparkling water - I can't believe past reviewers have complained about this feature as the minibar was re-filled daily and bearing in mind the time you actually spend in the room the quantity of drinks was ample for us and a nice treat after walking round barcelona each day. In the hotel's defence we thought that the breakfast was great - there was a huge array of juices, smoothies, breads, cheeses, meats, fruits (extra brownie points for juicy strawberries!), yoghurts, sandwiches, cakes and pastries, donuts, cookies as well as the usual eggs, bacon, hash browns, sausages. The breakfast was included in our rate, otherwise I doubt we would have paid the 20 euros per person charge - there is a little cafe called ramblas nearby. The pool was too cool to use however the jacuzzis were great with fab views of the city. All in all we thought the service was good - I found all staff to be friendly and willing to help - they had an english adaptor for us to use and even gave us an extra coca cola upon request. The internet is free to use in the lobby - another nice touch - and the connection was surprisingly fast. A tip I would use is to check the hotel's rates direct - we found it to be cheaper that way and also got breakfast included in the rate. We usually like to try out different hotels and different cities for our breaks but would definitely consider the AC group as it seems like a good quality group of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mybestholidays101010
Reviews.Content: We stayed gere for one nihgt while on business. The room was excellent...clean, big and thet bathroom was very nice and clean with everything you needed. Food was alittle pricey, but I guess you expect that in a city hotel. Highly recommended and would definaltey stay again when in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karl80
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because it is close to the conference centre and only a short distance on the metro to the city centre. We stayed at the hotel for three nights towards the end of November. The hotel is clean and reasonably priced. The bedroom was a good size (we had a double room with an extra bed for our son) but far too hot despite the outside temperature averaging 7°C. The air conditioning didn't work and the reception said they were unable to do anything about it. The double bed consisted of two singles pushed together. The bathroom was above average, with black marble and a frosted-glass washbasin. Each bedroom is stocked with a complimentary minibar which gets topped up daily, although it's fair to say the choice and size of drinks is limited! The fitness suite is pretty good, and we made full use of the three jacuzzis, although it was too cold to try the outside pool. Breakfast was relatively basic but I'm not sure if this is commonplace in Barcelona. The bar on the first floor is rather basic and lacked atmosphere. Coming from England, where smoking in bars is banned, it seemed really smokey but I guess that's commonplace throughout Spain. Reception tried to charge us full price even though my wife insisted we had a special conference rate. In the end this was resolved when my wife produced e-mail proof of the agreed lower rate. In all, not a bad hotel but I certainly don't think it's worth the full price quoted.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ahkat
Reviews.Content: I came to Barcelona because of a conference, and picked the AC because of its distance to the conference center. Apart from being extremely close, there is nothing good about this hotel. Some of my fellow co-workers called this hotel "Zen" jokingly, because of all the ammenities it lacks. For example, the hotel rooms does not have - a clock, a box of tissues, hair conditioner, a in-room safe, and an iron. I couldn't borrow an iron from the front desk to iron my shirt for work, there was no safe to store my passport, and worse of all... no clock! If you booked this hotel, please remember to bring all these items that comes standard in even the crappest 3 star hotels. Another problem with this hotel is the staff. They have no idea what is going on inside the hotel or outside. E.g. I asked for a non-smoking room and they put me in a room w/ an ashtray. When I complained, they tried to convince me that it is indeed a non-smoking room, just that "guest can at any time request an ashtray". What? Then what's the point of a non-smoking room. I found out from a different staff the next day that my floor 19 was indeed a smoking floor. I also asked for direction to a restaurant and they told me that it is across the street in the mall. I don't speak spainish, but after half an hour of trying to find directions, I went into the Hilton and the staff there told me the restaurant i am looking for is in La Rambles not across the street. Here are other stuff that I found disatifactory with this hotel. The breakfast is pathetic. The only hot items are bacon, disgusting looking eggs, potatoes and blood sausuage (which was also disgusting). The airconditioning of the room sucks. Do not pick a room that faces the water. Otherwise, you'll be waking up at 8am like I have been. The room gets too hot to sleep in once the sun come out. My recommendation, don't stay here. Stay at the Hilton or Princess which has all these basics ammenities and is just as close to the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zack121212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is complete Euro trash. The rooms are small, the TV is a 13 in CRT which picks nothing up but 15 Spanish channels and the staff is non-attentitive. Oh, not to mention the ambulance sirens that went by every 30 mins. I felt like I did and went to Ikea hell. The only positive is the fact you're right next to the convention center. But if you're requirement is close proximity to the convention center, stay at the Hilton right next door.. MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “Week in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondonCrawfords
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, a quiet location and about a 20 minuite train journey to the city centre. Room was fantastic with a spacious bathroom, the shower was extremely powerful. The room can get quite warm as the hotel switches off the air conditioning during winter (although the outside temperature was 16C!!) The jacuzzi was really nice and great for girls to relax after a packed day sightseeing. The saunas on the 13th floor have great views of the city rom the sauna... a great touch!! Room service was friendly and promt A nice hotel for a young couple although very expensive and may be a tad too pricy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences”
Reviews.Author: gallaron
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in the CCIB and was booked into the AC. Its literally part of the same building so no taxis etc required. Hotel was quite modern and room had a sea view. I didn't turn on the tv in the two days but was a bit of a throwback not to see a flat panel. Breakfast was ok and there was a reasonable selection. The pool on the 13th floor has a fantastic view but the water was very cold in October! Jacuzzi afterwards warmed me up. The AC is a bit out of town but its just a few minutes walk to the metro station and about 20 minutes from there to Placa Catalayuna with one line change.

Reviews.Title: “Ever feel like someone was playing with you”
Reviews.Author: justinhLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: What to say , well firstly the hotel is clean ad functional so can't mark it down on those points. However the staff all appeared a little like rabbits in headlights , nothing seemsed that fluid , every quesions was met with a sort of 'wow never been asked that before' sort of look , our questions weren't that strange ,how do we get to town , are there things to do locally , can you book me a taxi that sort of stuff. The decor just tries to be modern a little too hard , the place is cold and lifeless , a huge hotel but felt like we were there alone , breakfast is decidedly average , the presentation again tries to impress but its just a fake and you can tell, €20 for breakfast of poor tasteless re heated pastries and egg glupe that was supposed to be scrambled eggs. The area is very new and we found most things closed most of the time for our four day stay , it was August so I guess a lot of people on holiday but still it felt like such a planned neighbourhood, all we saw were these huge buildings and no one living there. Whats that tv programme "the prisoner" its like that everything is perfectly acceptable but you know its just not real , from the attempts at modern design such as the raw concrete walls to the silly over use of open space in the foyer , pitty they didn't spare some for the rooms or upgaded the 1980's TV. Overall the hotel was those cheap copies of european design that you get from asia , it looks right but once you use it once you know something isn't quite right. p.s. avoid the Casa y Tapas , its a chain of tapas bars nearby , its a health hazard.

Reviews.Title: “What A Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DohManc
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived home after spending 5 nights at the AC Barcelona hotel and I have to say after reading the mixed reviews about this hotel before we left England, I was really apprehensive about our stay. We got there and loved it! It was clean, modern and the staff were friendly. They Spanish aren't people pleasers like us Brits and didn't go out of their way to be over friendly, but were pleasant all the same. The views from the hotel were amazing. One side you could see the beach and panoramic views of the city on the other side (which you can see even when you're relaxing in the jacuzzi or sauna)! Its quite quiet where the hotel is and is nice to get away from the city. Also, as its only five minutes walk from the beach, you can have a beach holiday and city break all in one! We had room service the first night we got to the hotel and the food was little pricey, but I suppose that can be expected with all hotels. However, its close to a big shopping complex with a few outside eateries and there are other local cafe bars nearby. The hotel is minutes walk from the Metro (El Marsame) and only takes about 7 minutes to get to La Rambla (get off at Metro stop Juame) Port Vell, Port Olimpic and Barceloneta and is on the tram route and tourist bus route. I would definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mr_beng
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another hotel in barcelona before moving to this one. We called ahead to make sure check-in was 3 pm, and that we would get a king size bed. so we arrived approx 1 pm, left our bags and headed for the beach untill 3pm. when we arrived there was no rooms ready for us, and was told in a rude manner to come back in 2 hours...! I told them we called earlier, and was told to come back at 3 pm when we left our bags earlier, but the receptionist couldnt care less. so we had to spend 2 hours in beach-wear in the ridicolously overpriced pool-bar. so when we finally got our room everything looked ok, untill the neighbour arrived.... as mentioned in other reviews we also got a room with connecting door to people we don't know of,all night we can hear every single word the people in the other room was saying and doing. Also the banging of the door is very very loud. at checkout we were billed for drinks at the pool-bar thet we did not order, but after some paper-trailing this was corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: WelshTourist_7
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying for a week at the AC Barcelona. We found it a very comfortable, modern hotel, with all the amenities you would expect from a 4 star. The food was a bit pricey, but there is plenty of choice in the open air arcade just over the road. The staff were very friendly, and the room was fresh and clean. A great base, with a tube station (very easy to use, and cheap as chips!), 200 yards away. Roughly 10 minutes to the Ramblas in the tube. Nice area to walk around in the evening. Will definately book again to stay here. Great hotel in a cracking city!

Reviews.Title: “Modern stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: InspirationLondon
Reviews.Content: Modern stylish hotel located just 10 minute-taxi ride (approx. 10 Euros) from the hustle and bustle of Barcelona. Great pool - the water can be cold but that depends on the time of the year (it was relatively warm in July!). Lovely view and if you use it in the morning it's very quiet (before 1pm it can be totally empty). Same goes for the jacuzzis (3 of them, one is really big), the gym (small but with free weights) and sauna/spa. Rooms feature a modern style, very functional and big bathrooms. Constantly cleaned and tidied up (as you'd expect). One night I tried the restaurant and the beef was just perfectly done. It doesn't come cheap but this is what you've got to expect if you want to stay in a 4*! Excellent breakfast, freshly made smoothies and good variety of wholemeal breads. I would certainly recommend it for a relaxing stay if you've been to Barcelona before and want to avoid the busy crowds of Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: TeijaS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AC BCN the last two nights of our fabulous vacation. After spending the week in the heart of Born we wanted to relax near the beach. I had read lots positive comments on AC Barcelona and expected it to be a modern design hotel and I must say I was very disappointed. The 13 floor pool and sunbathing area was great and the restaurant was ok (a bit expensive though), but otherwise the hotel was surprisingly shabby, even old fashioned. Broken lobby table, rugged carpets, broken fire alarm hanging on the wall - little things that make a sloppy impression, Our room was the greatest disappointment: stuffy smell, television was straight from the 80's, cheapest possible cd player, our sea side view meant gray roofs and walls... The room had absolute nothing to do with design hotel, more like a very basic two star hotel in the countryside. So if you're a fan of design hotels and not booking a junior suite, don't expect much from the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: adelenicola
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a business trip from barcelona and was very impressed with the AC Barcelona. The location is great to explore the city, the rooms are modern and spacious, great bar area and the pool on the 13th floor is worth a visit for the views even if you dont swim! My only reservation was the service which was very slow on all occassions and not polite staff although everything else was well above my expectations. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_St_Helens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AC Barcelona for one night in April 2008. It is really nice business hotel. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. The room was good with a nice sea view. The breakfast was a self service buffet with a continental theme. It is a short 10 Euro taxi ride from La Rambla. We walked there but got a taxi home. It is a quiet area with a large shopping mall with bars restaurants directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business, not for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: robtk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the AC for 3 nights for a business event. And that's what this hotel is good for: business events/meetings. It is too far away from all the sights to use this hotel as your place to stay for a touristic visit of Barcelona. There is a metro station around the corner, and the hop-on-hop-off bus stops in front of the hotel, but I would not recommend this hotel for tourists. The hotel itself is a bit of a design hotel: all modern and trendy. The rooms are comfortable and the bathroom is very nice. It even had a bidet! Beds are good and the minibar is included n the room rate! There is a nice pool area on the 13th floor, although I didn't use the pool. Breakfast is ok, as is lunch. I didn't have diner in the hotel so I can't comment on that. The check-in went fast ans smooth, but I was surprised to find another suitcase in my new room. It turned out that the room was assigned to two people at the same time... Seems like they need an upgrade of their software. Anyway, it was taken care of in no time. The downside was the very poor wireless connection. I paid for 24 hours, but couldn't use the service most of the time because of poor reception. I think the capacity of the wireless network was not aadequate for the number of guests... All in all: good hotel fi you have to go to Barcelona for business, stay away if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinko5
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights for business. From outside the hotel is not impressive, the building looks more as an office block than a hotel. Once you are inside it's a different story, the lobby is very stylish, sleek design of rooms, wonderful views (I had a room on the 16th floor). The service was also very good, quick, good English, professional. I have especially liked the free minibar: i always hate those overpriced minbars in other hotels. I don't like to drink tap water, and I always end up overpaying for soft drinks from minibars. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for tourists, don't even think of a romantic weekend there. It's huge, impersonal, but stylish and functional. Also, very far from any tourist spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpofarre
Reviews.Content: After a recent hosting of a 3-day seminar at this facility, I can say that we were quite pleased. We have stuggled with accomodations in Barca in the past, as it's difficult to find that cost/quality/location balance - with here things were different. Located in Diagonal Mar, it's just far enough away from Born and other areas of the city that might draw people's attention away from a seminar, making it a good spot for business stays. However, I found about a 10 Euro taxi ride would put you back in the action. Just a few hotels over stands the Hilton, as well as Princess, which I believe are slightly more expensive. The quality of the rooms were justified for the cost, and housekeeping was quite attentive as I always found the room in order when I would return, no matter if I left the room first thing in the morning or later in the day. As this hotel was handling multiple seminars at once, I felt they did a fantastic job. Seldom was there any cross traffic between the different groups, and when groups did exit the salons for a break, it did not disrupt us at all. There were some small requests that went unattended (light bulb removal, extra tables positioned), but these were merely small matters that we easily took care of on our own. Overall, I definitely recommend the facilities for a seminar/conference. Regarding the rooms, I had to deal with the following issues: 1. There were some problems with the air conditioning for a day, which made the rooms quite warm. As it was April, this was easily fixed with an open window, though I'm not sure of the frequency of this problem. 2. It was advertised that the minibar was free of charge each day, but a look in revealed two small beers (one non-alcoholic), water, and a few soft drinks. This wasn't a bother personally as I figured it was the case, but other people seemed quite upset about it. 3. They provide a golf ball soap that is rather neat. Problem was with multiple nights, that golf ball eventually became small enough to slip out of my hands and fall into the drain hole for the sink and become lodged. It took quite a while to remove it. 4. Internet is wireless and provided by Telefonica - you should get the card from the lobby each day as it is needed. I chose to purchase via credit card each day from the comfort of the room, and the two repeat charges triggered the alarm that locked two of my credit cards throughout the stay. I travel a fair amount, so my purchases are erratic already, but this set it off for some reason. All in all, a good stay, and I know if we return to Barcelona again next year for our seminar, we will most likely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience at a Price”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: The AC Barcelona is a comfortable, modern hotel with a cool stylish feel to it. The standard rooms really are deluxe rooms. I have stayed here before in a junior suite and to be honest, with the obvious difference in size, the comfort level is fairly similar. All rooms have a great marble bathroom, bathrobes and a free (if limited) minibar. Get a room with a sea view if possible. The level of service (and standard of English for an international hotel) was fairly uneven but overall "OK". I was here for a conference and did feel exploited by the high price of the room - about 120 euros per night more than a couple days earlier when the conference was not on. It is however right beside the conference centre (CCIB) so you pay for the convenience. The AC Barcelona is a few minutes walk to the sea which is also a big plus but it really is in the middle of a business zone so I would have to get a fairly good deal to stay here if I was on a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: John071
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in a twin room, Comfortable, free minibar, decent breakfast. The first night there was a concert on my side of the hotel, which meant a very noisy night till apx 03.00am. This makes it a neutral, otherwise it would have been above average. Just my bad luck I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel-rude staff”
Reviews.Author: stratia
Reviews.Content: is a very nice and big hotel 50 m from the metro station, very clean and modern.very good breakfast. but...very expensive.everything to eat or drink inside is very expensive.and the staff was rude.
